meanings.definition: A special right, advantage, or immunity granted or available only to a particular person or group.
meanings.sent1: Having privileges at school means you can go to the library whenever you want.
meanings.sent2: The country club members enjoy many privileges, such as access to the exclusive golf course.
meanings.sent3: It's like having a secret key that unlocks all the special doors - that's what privileges feel like.
meanings.sent4: The privileges of being a VIP include skipping lines and getting the best seats in the house.
meanings.sent5: Imagine privileges as a golden ticket that lets you enter any event without waiting in line.

meanings.definition: The right to say or do something that is not usually allowed.
meanings.sent1: As a student council member, you have the privileges to organize fun events for the school.
meanings.sent2: Freedom of speech is one of the most important privileges granted to citizens in a democracy.
meanings.sent3: When you have the privileges to eat dessert before dinner, it feels like breaking a delicious rule.
meanings.sent4: Her voice carried the privileges of authority, commanding attention in the crowded room.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush danced on the canvas, wielding the privileges of creativity and expression.
